content.title: Visceral Artery Pseudoaneurysm
content.description: False aneurysm of visceral arteries, often secondary to pancreatitis, trauma, or iatrogenic injury.

clinical_features.presentation: May present with GI bleeding, intraperitoneal hemorrhage, or hemobilia

treatment.endovascular_preferred: Coil embolization is first-line for most pseudoaneurysms

content.clinical_pearl: Unlike true aneurysms, pseudoaneurysms have no waiting period - treat promptly due to high rupture risk
